2007-12-00-blue-original.description:
The original plush elephpant. At least six generations were produced over several years by the French company Nexen, which became part of Alter Way.

The third photo shows the first elephpant ever produced. A prototype for the first generation, it has the php logo in a different color. This elephpant is affectionately known as trisaïeul.

2008-03-12-blue-oracle.description: Given to attendees at the 2008 PHP Quebec Conference (now ConFoo), and also to the attendees of the 2008 php|tek Conference (now php[tek]).

2011-10-00-pink-original.description: This was the second color released. It was produced alongside the sixth generation of "original" blue elephpants.

2012-09-00-green-zf2.description: The green color matches the Zend Framework logo.

2014-01-16-orange-phparch.name: Archie
2014-01-16-orange-phparch.description: Originally made available through a Kickstarter campaign. The orange color matches the php[architect] logo.

2014-02-06-purple-phpwomen.name: Umoja
2014-02-06-purple-phpwomen.description: Originally available through a Kickstarter campaign, this elephpant can now be purchased directly from the php[architect] swag store. The color matches the PHP Women logo. Profits from the sale of this elephpant support PHP Women's programs including conference scholarships.

2014-02-06-yellow-sunshinephp.name: Sonny
2014-02-06-yellow-sunshinephp.description: The elephpant was originally designed for the Sunshine PHP Conference. It was given out to attendees at the conference in 2014 and 2015.

2014-09-05-red-laravel.name: Liona
2014-09-05-red-laravel.description: This elephpant was produced via a Kickstarter campaign. The color matches the Laravel logo.

2014-10-28-blue-apigility.description: This elephpant was originally intended for attendees at ZendCon 2014. It is based on the Apigility logo which shows a flying elephpant with a rocket strapped to its back. Because it was thought that the elephpant looked like it was firing a rocket, the Z-Ray elephpant was designed and released instead. Only the prototype of this design was created. It used a lighter color blue than previous elephpants.

2014-10-28-blue-zray.description: This elephpant was given away to attendees at ZendCon 2014. It wears a pair of glasses with red spirals that represent the Z-Ray debugging tool for Zend Server.

2014-11-27-black-amsterdamphp.name: MurPHPy
2014-11-27-black-amsterdamphp.description:
This elephpant was produced via a Kickstarter campaign. The colors match the AmsterdamPHP logo, which in turn match the flag and coat of arms of the City of Amsterdam.

The name MurPHPy was kindly given by the organizers of AmsterdamPHP after facing a multitude of troubles during the packing and shipping stages of the campaign.

Currently it's available for sale from the the AmsterdamPHP Shop.

2015-03-05-white-confoo.name: Phil Snow
2015-03-05-white-confoo.description: This elephpant was released in 2016 and is available for sale from ConFoo.

2015-06-02-brown-truenorthphp.name: Molly
2015-06-02-brown-truenorthphp.description:
This animal has smaller ears than an elephpant, and tusks. The body of the mammoth consists of both plush fur and longer hair.

The woolly mammoth was produced as a giveaway for the 2015 TrueNorth PHP Conference in Toronto, Canada. A Kickstarter campaign was held to help fund the giveaways.

Due to a production delay, the mammoths were not available in time for the conference and were instead distributed to TrueNorth PHP attendees primarily through meetups in and around Toronto. The mammoths were released and started shipping to Kickstarter backers in January 2016.

2015-06-08-gold-opengoodies.description:
A true rarity, only one of these elephpants exists in the wild. It was designed by OpenGoodies to celebrate PHP's 20th anniversary on June 8, 2015. After developing the prototype the project was canceled because final production would not be ready in time. The single prototype was put up for auction on Ebay on the day of the anniversary. The auction was won by Zend Technologies co-founder Zeev Suraski.

This is the first elephpant that does not have plush fur. It has a circular disc on the right-rear leg showing the "Official ElePHPant" logo.

This elephpant has its own Twitter account at @gelephpant.

2015-06-19-blue-opengoodies.description:
The newest edition of the classic blue elephpant. It is produced by OpenGoodies, which succeeded Nexen/Alter Way as the official producer of elephpants.

This edition is distinguished from previous generations by the OpenGoodies logo on the rear tag.

2015-06-19-pink-opengoodies.description:
The newest edition of the pink elephpant. It is produced by OpenGoodies, which succeeded Nexen/Alter Way as the official producer of elephpants.

This edition is distinguished from the previous edition by the OpenGoodies logo on the rear tag.

2015-09-11-gray-hack.description:
Produced by the HHVM/Hack team at Facebook. It has not been released publicly. It has a HHVM logo in place of the PHP logo. Three prototypes have been produced followed by 500 which will not be available for sale.

The pHackyderm has several features that distinguish it from an elephpant including an articulated trunk, robotic eye, and boots.

The first prototype is named Steve, the second Steph, and the third and final Steven. All have the HHVM plate on the obverse side. The initial prototype has a blank reverse, but the later protypes and production pHackyderms will have the Hack logo and text on the reverse side.

2015-10-13-multicolored-haphpy.sponsor: Association Française des Utilisateurs de PHP (AFUP) - French PHP User Group
2015-10-13-multicolored-haphpy.description: This one-of-a-kind elephpant was handcrafted by V. Fanzutti. It has been offered to the Kenya PHP User Group for their contribution for the 20th HaPHPy Birthday.

2015-10-19-teal-zen.description:
Also described as turquoise. This elephpant was given away to attendees at ZendCon 2015.

The PHP logo on the obverse has a "7" included to signify the release of PHP 7.

2015-11-06-black-symfony-10-years.description: This elephpant was designed to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the Symfony Framework. Only 300 were available and were sold exclusively at SymfonyCon 2015 in Paris.

2016-01-01-black-symfony.description: This elephpant has been sold at Symfony-related events starting in 2016.

2016-02-19-blue-shopware.name: Cody Blou
2016-02-19-blue-shopware.description: This elephant will be distributed primarily to Shopware contributors and community members. Cody has its own Twitter account at @CodyBlou.

2016-06-02-white-globalis.name: Echo
2016-06-02-white-globalis.description:
Only 400 small and 5 jumbo-size of these elePHPants were made, and will be delivered primarily to GLOBALIS team members, partners, friends, and customers.

His name, Echo, refers to the PHP echo command and also as tribute to Echo, the famous elephant matriarch who was studied for over 30 years.

2016-06-24-white-dpc.reverse: ibuildings Dutch PHP Conference, with the DPC logo
2016-06-24-white-dpc.description: This elephpant was given away to attendees at the 2016 Dutch PHP Conference.

2016-10-18-white-zen.name: ElPHPis
2016-10-18-white-zen.description:
This elephpant was given away to attendees at ZendCon 2016.

The name ElPHPis was given by the community because of his trademark sideburns.

2016-10-27-multicolored-phpdiversity.name: Enfys
2016-10-27-multicolored-phpdiversity.description:
Inspired by a photoshopped image by a Slovenian PHP developer called Peter Kokot. This elephpant was produced via a Kickstarter campaign.

The name Enfys (pronounced EN-vis) is a Welsh name meaning "rainbow", that is gender-neutral; and Enfys is intended to promote Diversity within the worldwide PHP development community regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, nationality, disability, religion and technology.

2017-05-19-blue-afup.sponsor: Association Française des Utilisateurs de PHP (AFUP) - French PHP User Group
2017-05-19-blue-afup.description: This elephpant was released in 2017 at AFUP's annual Forum PHP conference.

2017-06-11-blue-cakedc.description: This elephpant is available to CakeDC's clients and at events that CakeDC sponsors.

2017-06-11-green-cakefest.description: Announced at CakeFest 2017, these are available to CakeFest attendees.

2017-09-22-denim-zen.description:
This elephpant was given away to attendees at ZendCon 2017.

The denim material makes this the first widely-distributed elephpant with non-plush fur.

This is the first Zend-branded elephpant to use the Rogue Wave logo.

2018-04-14-php-yorkshire.name: Jorvik
2018-04-14-php-yorkshire.description: This elephpant was available at the 2018 PHP Yorkshire conference

2018-05-30-purple-php-roundtable.name: Pollita (in honor of Sara Golemon)
2018-05-30-purple-php-roundtable.description:
The first and only elephpant created for a PHP Podcast. It's fuzzier than standard elephpants and sports nifty logo nails and white feet pads. Only 500 were made.

This elephpant is currently available for sale at PHPRoundtable.com.

2018-07-01-silver-phpvegas.description:
This elephpant was designed by the PHP Vegas user group. An Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign was run produce it. However, it did not hit its funding target and the prototype remains the only one of this subspecies in existence.

The name PHPlashy is an ode to the lights and glamor of Las Vegas, NV.

2018-10-15-blue-zendcon.name: Zoe
2018-10-15-blue-zendcon.description: This elephpant was given away to attendees at ZendCon 2018.

2019-01-07-blue-php-classes.description: Available for sale on the PHP Classes website. First officially-licensed elePHPant to have sewn eyes

2019-01-25-white-phpbenelux.name: Luxy
2019-01-25-white-phpbenelux.reverse: PHPBenelux Conference logo/"10 years of conferences"
2019-01-25-white-phpbenelux.description: This elephpant was released at the 10th PHP Benelux conference in 2019

2019-02-07-yellow-sunshinephp-nexmo.name: Sonny
2019-02-07-yellow-sunshinephp-nexmo.description: The elephpant is only available to attendees of the Sunshine PHP Conference. It has a slightly more orange hue than the previous Sunshine PHP elephpant, and the Nexmo logo replaces the Zend logo.

2019-02-18-white-phpers.description: This elePHPant was available to attendees of the PHPers Summit 2019

2019-05-14-black-phpstor.description: Provided to the most active participants in the PhpStorm Early Access Program

2019-05-23-pink-shopware.name: Cody Vuelette
2019-05-23-pink-shopware.description: Announced at Shopware Community Day 2019 this celebrates the launch of Shopware 6 and has a Shopware 6 tag on its left ear

2019-06-07-yellow-darkmira.name: Unity
2019-06-07-yellow-darkmira.description: This elePHPant was produced by a Brasilian manufacturer and was available to attendees of the Darkmira PHP Tour.

2019-07-04-blue-check24.name: JePHPry
2019-07-04-blue-check24.description: This elephant will be distributed primarily to CHECK24 and community members. JePHPry has its own Twitter account at @CHECK24_JePHPry.

2019-10-03-red-phpcon-polan.name: Janusz
2019-10-03-red-phpcon-polan.description: This elePHPant was available to attendees of PHPCon Poland 2019

2019-11-15-gray-symfony.description: This elephpant has been sold at Symfony-related events starting in 2019.

2019-11-21-white-phpconjapan.description: Commemorating the 20th PHP conference, this elePHPant was available to attendees of PHP Conference Japan 2019.

2020-05-25-black-upinside.description: This elePHPant is available from the Upinside School

2020-09-14-blue-confoo.name: Le Foo du Roi "The Joker"
2020-09-14-blue-confoo.description: This elephpant was announced in 2020 to celebrate the release of PHP 8. It features a jester's hat on its head, giving to the name Le Foo du Roi meaning "The King's Foo" in French. It can be purchased in the ConFoo store

2020-09-18-multicolored-phpday.name: Aida
2020-09-18-multicolored-phpday.description: This elephpant is green, white, and red like the flag of Italy and was produced by GrUSP and is available for sale in the GrUSP store

2020-10-23-gray-symfony.description: This elephpant was designed to celebrate the 15th anniversary of the Symfony Framework. This elephpant is currently available for sale at shop.symfony.com.

2020-11-28-php8-opengoodies.description: To celebrate the PHP8.0 release the original creators of the elePHPant, Damien Seguy and Vincent Pontier created inPHPinity, a Community Driven Elephpant. It can be purchased here

2020-12-07-pink-php-classes.description: Available for sale on the PHP Classes website.
